intro: Psychotria cuprea, commonly known as the red psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark red to almost black leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria cuprea is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of psychoactive compounds.
